item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: I wrote last year about some striking studies that found microbes living in tumors. Now some of those studies are under fire. Here's my new story on the debate. [Gift link] https://www.nytimes.com/2023/08/25/health/cancer-microbes-debate.html?unlocked_article_code=bQsZopoVRqJgkclB2fg2CfPecCLlx2vb-O9rUkb8vq19HEwt42Z6A6rCdbocrMdQmoWGDeIf_txQfP362VNx3Pe6a6v7LYroWp2cUNWtWHLKQzcNlQshy0A_WnhfVrBPtDXiKkCTlPTon5QFs-W6qig3oYf3CtitdpUFoIMlANx35UgHD7qXQCnFR2kqvYpi0cnZqksEbZIdUGjS9m-NljOI0KUN67znJmaLbOaN_wNiS5UIQfjAq_xFB5j0YDHI72kWe8s1pUUP2Ej2V9RY4qRTBgvN7shf5Dy91D8vn3SUcRp4qS1qkf-84v5TZm7GAjbS7_YJgkl3cTiFnrHC&smid=url-share

item.title: Natalie Sedacca
item.description: ‚ÄúI want to ask a question of the people who made the decision to put us on the barge. ‚ÄòWould you put a member of your family there even for one day?‚Äô We came to the UK to escape persecution but are facing more persecution here.‚ÄùAsylum seekers say conditions on Bibby Stockholm barge caused suicide attempt https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2023/aug/25/asylum-seekers-bibby-stockholm-conditions-suicide-attempt#AsylumSeekers #refugees #humanrights

item.title: BenedicteCallan
item.description:
Scientists are moving from X-itter. Almost half have opened accounts with Mastodon, the highest of all the other social networking sites according to a Nature survey.
https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-023-02554-0

item.title: Maria Popova
item.description: The Woman Who Smashed Codes ‚Äì the remarkable story of cryptography pioneer Elizebeth Friedman, born on this day in 1892, who helped defeat the Nazis with pencil, paper, and perseverance https://t.co/S1sRKDYtui

item.title: Cian O‚ÄôDonnell
item.description: My issue is this: for most questions I am interested in, ANNs simply aren't "biologically plausible" enough.The claim that ANNs are in a sweet spot carries an implicit assumption about the set of questions that are interesting. Which is of course subjective!

item.title: Dan Goodman
item.description: If you're at #CCN2023 and interested in multimodal processing, come and chat with us at our poster P-3B.68 with @marcusghosh from 1-3pm today in the Marquee.https://2023.ccneuro.org/view_paper.php?PaperNum=1062If you're not at CCN, check our thread/preprint and we'd be happy to discuss!https://neuromatch.social/@neuralreckoning/110785811144218374

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
It's all about the rhythms. Oscillations play critical roles in brain function. The answer is "yes".Are physiological oscillations physiological?
https://physoc.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/epdf/10.1113/JP285015#neuroscience

item.title: Matteo Carandini
item.description: And yet universities were far from universal, as they excluded women. It took 600 years from the opening of the first University (Bologna) in 1088 to the first woman graduating. Her name? Elena Cornaro Piscopia. She graduated in Padua in 1678, in philosophy. She was not allowed to graduate in theology, and not allowed to teach afterwards. But she graduated. (Cambridge and Oxford did not follow suit, so in England women had to wait another 150 years for University College London to open). (4/4)

item.title: Manlio De Domenico
item.description: Four pictures taken by NASA missions over time. The product of human intelligence mixed to our curiosity and that persistent question in our mind: are we alone? Four pictures that should give us a better perspective about our life, and how rare and precious our planet is, with its life, in the vast emptiness of the Universe. In order, the pictures: 1968, 175,000 miles, from Apollo 8 around Moon2014, 99 million miles, from Curiosity on Mars2013, 898 million miles, from Cassini around Saturn1990, 3.7 billion miles, from Voyager I

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description: I just got a comments back from someone and they changed all of the spaces in the filename to underscores and I'm thinking, "What!? You are TOO YOUNG for spaces in filenames to have ever been a real issue in your life. What happened to make you do this?!"

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description: What is happening when we're waiting for submission management system web sites to convert our PDFs into different PDFs? And how many tons of CO2 are involved?
